intro: Cassebeera atropurpurea, commonly known as the purple-leaf cassava, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple foliage and yellowish-green stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are edible when properly prepared, though the plant contains toxic compounds that require careful processing. Cassebeera atropurpurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its potential agricultural uses.
